p: Both Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus females were screened for ZIKV and DENV by real-time RT-PCR. Aedes head-thorax parts were dissected from the abdominal parts and separately transferred into microfuge tubes containing RPMI medium. Both mosquito parts (head-thorax and abdomen) were homogenized in RPMI medium using a Bullet Blender ® Storm (Next Advance, Inc., Troy, NY, USA). Supernatant was collected for a total nucleic acid extraction using a PureLinkTM Viral RNA/DNA Mini Kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA) according to the manufacturer’s instruction.
